Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence to support the assertion that the images show Indian soldiers at Siachen Glacier. The only evidence provided is the images themselves, which have been shared on social media.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the images are actually of Russian soldiers, as confirmed by fact-checking organizations and previous investigations.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the images by presenting them as evidence of Indian soldiers enduring extreme conditions at Siachen Glacier, when in reality they are old images of Russian soldiers.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the images are of Indian soldiers without providing any substantial proof or verification.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists, which is that the images are of Russian soldiers and not Indian soldiers, as confirmed by fact-checking organizations and previous investigations.
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by presenting the images as evidence without verifying their authenticity or providing additional context.
